conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs for Car A and Car B to determine acceleration changes from t=0 to t=t1.
At t=0, Car A has velocity v1 and Car B has velocity v2.
Car A's velocity decreases from v1 to v2; Car B's velocity increases from v2 to v1.
Car A's decreasing velocity implies decreasing acceleration; Car B's increasing velocity implies increasing acceleration.
Car A's velocity decreases more sharply than Car B's velocity increases.
Magnitude of Car A's acceleration is greater than Car B's.
Car A's acceleration decreases gradually; Car B's acceleration increases gradually.
During t=0 to t=t1, magnitude of Car A's acceleration is greater than Car B's.
